articles.title: Surging Seattle Mariners outlast Texas Rangers in 10 innings, extend winning streak to 13 games
articles.description: The dancing, prancing Seattle Mariners stretched their winning streak to 13 games, defeating the Texas Rangers 3-2 on Saturday, moving closer to the club-record 15-game winning streak set in their last playoff season of 2001.
articles.content:
ARLINGTON, Texas -- J.P. Crawford hit an RBI single in the 10th inning and the Seattle Mariners stretched their winning streak to 13 games, defeating the Texas Rangers 3-2 on Saturday.

articles.title: Justin Verlander gets league-leading 12th win, passes Curt Schilling, Bob Gibson on all-time strikeouts list
articles.description: Houston Astros' 39-year-old Justin Verlander collected his MLB-leading 12th win in Saturday's 5-0 win over the Oakland Athletics and moved past Curt Schilling and Bob Gibson into 14th place on the all-time strikeouts list.
articles.content:
HOUSTON -- After collecting his MLB-leading 12th win Saturday, Justin Verlander wasn't ready to reflect on how far he's come this season.

articles.title: New York Yankees starter Luis Severino (right shoulder) not expected to throw for two weeks
articles.description: Yankees starter Luis Severino, nursing a shoulder injury after struggling through a start against the Cincinnati Reds this week, is not expected to throw for two weeks, New York manager Aaron Boone said on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Rory McIlroy, Viktor Hovland avoid blunders, share lead at Open Championship
articles.description: Rory McIlroy moved into the void left by the departure of Tiger Woods at The Open, holing a bunker shot for eagle and revving up the gallery at St. Andrews at every turn Saturday as he moved closer to ending eight years without a major.

articles.title: Troy Bowles, No. 26 football prospect in ESPN 300, commits to Georgia
articles.description: Linebacker Troy Bowles, son of Tampa Bay Buccaneers coach Todd Bowles, has committed to Georgia. Troy Bowles is ranked No. 26 in the ESPN 300 for the class of 2023.
articles.content:
Linebacker Troy Bowles, the No. 26 prospect in the ESPN 300, committed to Georgia football Saturday.

articles.title: Houston Astros' Jose Altuve out of All-Star Game, Cleveland Guardian's Andres Giménez to start at 2B
articles.description: Houston Astros star Jose Altuve will not play in Tuesday's All-Star Game and will be replaced by Cleveland's Andrés Giménez at second base.

articles.title: Sources - Washington Nationals open to listening to Juan Soto trade offers after $440M contract rejected
articles.description: The Nationals are willing to listen to trade offers for Juan Soto after the star outfielder rejected a 15-year, $440 million contract offer, league sources confirmed to ESPN.
articles.content:

articles.description: How many of this year's All-Stars are Hall of Fame-bound? We break down every player's chances into tiers from the no-doubters to the longest of long shots.
